The story is well written to accurately describe the dilemma of dealing with uncovered cheating, BUT I don't find it totally realistic. A 50/50. Its characters cannot be said to be realistic: A pathetic MC who hasn't had sex for 4 years is possible but not an everyday thing (realistic), a woman who is unfaithful to her husband with guys who have nothing in common (not even the physical nor in the personality) seems to me completely fictitious. It's just a way the author wants the reader to identify with these stereotypes. I repeat, the story reflects well the problem of a couple facing infidelity, but the reason and the development of this infidelity is fiction.

People confuse netorare or NTR to be the same with cheating; NTR typically involves an individual getting forced to have sex whether by blackmailing or some dumb plot, while cheating is just sex with another man but with consent. Yes, NTR IS cheating but there it is FORCED. Ya get it? So the tag was a bit misleading because the woman here cheated on her husband with her own accord, and it almost made me skip this.  In the the next chapter is maybe NTR judging by the dialogues "A liar, a despicable, violent of a man". Anyways, that husband was dumb as fuck. Now, usually i hate ntr. But thats because they almost always follow this one overused format. Guy messes up mildly, girl goes for another man, guy cries. Thats how it usualy boils down. Sometimes even without the guy making a bad decision. This, however, follows it, but its actually realistic. I can see this play out in real life. Its a piece that actually has effort behind it, and not just some random cuck shit thrown onto a template. As much as i despise works of ntr, this has its own place above the others.

This was a great cheating story. Others have already described the good writing. The sex scene, too. The husband — what a mess. Four years of denying sex? That’s grounds for divorce in many states. It will ruin a marriage. I went through something similar and I really understand that cheating wife. I was ready to do the same, but of all the choices and possibilities none was better than making it work. I learned that you have to make ways to talk about sex because eventually nature will stop pressing the buttons for you.
This ntr story, if done correctly, will be my first, and final, favorite ntr story.

Normally I dread NTR, but in this case I sympathize with the woman - if he neglects her for years and prefers to jerk off, he deserves what comes.
As to why he is listening - he may have confronted her with the evidence and for now wants answers; assuming his wife is having an affair and trying to pin it on her just being horny might be what he originally intended to do, but starting with "you didn't touch me for 4 years and then i find out you prefer porn over me" is a strong motivation to seek confirmation as a woman.

The fact she started out with anonymous guys, intending only One Night Stands instead of enjoying the emotional component speaks for her honest love - it's just that love does not equal sex and the husband seemingly never considered his wife to be craving both.

Honestly my only issue with this story is why the husband would sit and listen to all the gory details, unless he's a cuck. Why the fuck would you want to know how she blew the guy and swallowed. But it's still a clever way to present the story to us the readers.

@glad1985 Well, she still loves him and supposedly we'll find out in the next chapter why she's ready to accept whatever decision that Naoki comes to regarding their marriage after she tells him about the 3rd guy as apparently that's the one that made her resolve to confess(Naoki simply beat her to the punch by confronting her).

Lmao for all the people complaining yes she should have left him first instead of cheating, but she still loved him and wanted to stay with him. Whats so hard to believe about that. She was just trying to get her sexual needs satisfied elsewhere because the husband wasn't doing his job. She wanted a baby he said no, she wanted to go back to work he said no, she tried to talk to him about her sexual frustration he kept shutting her down. The husband is a complete dickhead i hope she ends up with this takumi guy at the end of it all.
Also people who think she has every right to cheat on her husband are pretty stupid.

Shout out to @DrinkandDame for their explanation when this was still in Japanese, I have been looking forward to this since your plot summary! And compliments to the artist for this intriguing story with actual nuanced characters that are compelling and give reasons for their actions. Definitely looking forward to the rest of the series and to what decision both Akiko and her husband come down to. Part 2 is definitely going to be brutal to read and get through, but I am sure it is all part of the development for Akiko's character to lead up to the final part with the older gentleman. For sure though this looks to be my favorite of the first two parts because Takumi seemed like a good, genuine dude. Glad to see this get a very good translation.
Anybody calling the husband a bastard, I hope your wife cucks you when you finally settle down for no reason at all, out of pure spite.

Yeah neglect will kill a relationship but you have to engage in dialogue - your partner deserves to know how youre feeling before you go as far as to cheat. Its fucking stupid to cheat when your partner clearly has a sex drive too, communication is key. Honestly the most dissapointing thing for me about this one is the total lack of guilt from the wife.

Both are retarded. Husband that doesn't touch his wife for 4 years and thinks everything is fine. Wife that, instead of talking it out first, immediately jumps to cheating. You really can't empathize with either side. Sometimes I'm curious if those scenarios are made up and forced, or is that level of lack of communication actually present in Japanese marriages, even those that are born from love instead of convenience. Really curious what's her play here, revealing it all like this.
